article.title: NCAA approves 35 bowls for next four years
article.body:
The NCAA has approved 35 bowl games over the next four year, allowing 70 Football Bowl Subdivision schools to take part in the postseason, according to the Associated Press.

The NCAA said the bowls were licensed on a four-year cycle for the first time, putting them on the same cycle as bowl-conference agreements, according to the report.

The 2010 season schedule will feature two new bowls - the Pinstripe Bowl at Yankee Stadium on Dec. 30 and the Dallas Football Classic at the Cotton Bowl on Jan. 1, 2011.
